questions.question: What does the term 'discrete' in Discrete Mathematics mean?
options: That values can be any real number
That values can only be certain separate, distinct numbers
That calculations are carried out discretely
That the mathematical operations are discreet and not public
questions.correct_answer: That values can only be certain separate, distinct numbers

questions.question: In the context of graph theory, what is a vertex?
options: A connection between two nodes
A central point in the graph
A point where two or more lines meet
The maximum number of edges in a graph
questions.correct_answer: A point where two or more lines meet

questions.question: What is the pigeonhole principle?
options: If you have more pigeons than pigeonholes, at least one pigeonhole has to contain more than one pigeon
Pigeons always return to their own pigeonholes
Pigeonholes should always be in odd numbers
All pigeonholes should be of the same size
questions.correct_answer: If you have more pigeons than pigeonholes, at least one pigeonhole has to contain more than one pigeon

questions.question: What is a binary relation?
options: A relation between two sets
A relation involving two numbers
A relation that is true or false
A relation that can only have two values

questions.question: What does 'n!' represent in Discrete Mathematics?
options: The factorial of n
The sum of the first n numbers
The product of the first n numbers
The square root of n

questions.question: What is the name of the sequence: 0, 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13, 21...?
options: Lucas Sequence
Pell Sequence
Fibonacci Sequence
Catalan Sequence

questions.question: In graph theory, what is a simple path?
options: A path where each vertex is unique
A path that starts and ends at the same vertex
A path where each edge is unique
A path that only includes two vertices
questions.correct_answer: A path where each vertex is unique

questions.question: In set theory, what does the union of sets A and B represent?
options: Elements that are in both A and B
Elements that are in A but not in B
Elements that are in A or in B or in both
Elements that are in A and B but not in their intersection
questions.correct_answer: Elements that are in A or in B or in both

questions.question: What does the 'floor function', often denoted as ⌊x⌋, do to the number x?
options: Rounds it up to the nearest integer
Rounds it down to the nearest integer
Rounds it to the nearest integer
Finds the square root
questions.correct_answer: Rounds it down to the nearest integer

questions.question: What is a bijection in the context of functions?
options: A function that is both injective and surjective
A function that has an inverse
A function that passes the vertical line test
A function where every input has two outputs
questions.correct_answer: A function that is both injective and surjective
